page.title: 05ECOLOGY OF FLAX BOURTON
page.content: Bourton Combe is on the southern edge of Flax Bourton.It is a good example of limestone ecolgy.There is a large Turkey Oak,and many rhhododendrums with pink,mouve and white flowers. There are Holly,Beach,Oak,Yew,Sycamore ,Spindleberry and Hazle trees.A few trees had fallen down and have wood peckers living in them.In one place there was a barley field.We saw pretty red campion and ivy leaves.I smelt some wild garlic,it was strong.In Autumn there are lots of fungi like,Bracket fungus,and Jews ears.The hearts tonuge ferns were tall and green,and the dog rose was small,we saw beetles,dead mice,butterflies and birds.There are lots of small mamals like,squirrels,foxes and especially badgers.
